common.tagline: Connecting bilingual families, educators, and childcare centers

footer.aboutText: LittleBridge connects Mandarin-speaking families with childcare centers and bilingual educators who truly value cultural and linguistic diversity.
footer.builtWith: Built with love in Sydney & Melbourne

hero.titleLine1: Give your child the gift of
hero.subtitle: Find childcare centers with genuine Mandarin programs, bilingual staff, and cultural understanding — whether you want your child to maintain their mother tongue or learn a new language.
hero.trustedBy: Trusted by families across Sydney & Melbourne

valueProp.title: Why LittleBridge?
valueProp.subtitle: We bridge the gap between bilingual families and quality childcare

card1.title: Find real bilingual programs
card1.description: Not just 'we have one Chinese staff member.' Find centers with structured Mandarin programs, bilingual curriculum, and staff who genuinely use both languages daily.

card2.title: Cultural connection that matters
card2.description: From celebrating Chinese New Year to understanding dietary preferences, find centers where your family's culture is part of daily life — not just a poster on the wall.

card3.title: Everyone can communicate
card3.description: Whether it's you, your parents, or your in-laws doing drop-off — everyone can talk to the staff. Send enquiries in Chinese or English, and the center gets both.

forFamilies.title: Find care where your child feels at home
forFamilies.description: Search by location, bilingual programs, and what matters to your family. See which centers have Mandarin-speaking staff, structured bilingual curriculum, and availability — all in Chinese and English.
forFamilies.benefit1: Find centers with structured Mandarin programs
forFamilies.benefit2: See which staff speak Mandarin, Cantonese, or both
forFamilies.benefit3: Enquire in Chinese or English — centers get both
forFamilies.benefit4: Perfect for grandparents who do pickup too

forEducators.title: Find centers that truly value your bilingual skills
forEducators.description: Stop being the 'nice bonus' bilingual staff member. Find centres that program for bilingual education and pay a fair premium for your skills.
forEducators.benefit2: Match scores based on your qualifications and preferences
forEducators.benefit3: Centers that actually value bilingual programming
forEducators.benefit4: Competitive pay reflecting your bilingual premium

forCenters.title: Attract families who value what you offer
forCenters.description: Reach families actively seeking bilingual childcare — from Mandarin-speaking households to English-speaking parents who want immersion programs. Plus find qualified bilingual educators.
forCenters.benefit1: Reach families specifically seeking bilingual programs
forCenters.benefit3: Find qualified bilingual educators without agency fees

testimonial1.quote: My English is fine — that's not why I use LittleBridge. I use it because I want my daughter to grow up speaking Mandarin as naturally as I did. Finding a center with a real bilingual program was impossible before this.
testimonial1.author: Wei

testimonial2.quote: Every center says they value diversity. I want to work at one that actually programs for it.
testimonial2.author: Sophie

testimonial3.quote: My mother-in-law does pickup three days a week. She doesn't speak any English. Knowing there's staff she can talk to about how my son's day went — that's priceless.
testimonial3.author: Michelle

ccs.title: Understanding the Child Care Subsidy
ccs.subtitle: The Australian Government helps families with childcare costs through the Child Care Subsidy (CCS).
ccs.whatIsCcs: The Child Care Subsidy is a government payment that reduces what you pay for childcare. Most families who use approved childcare in Australia receive some level of CCS.
ccs.howItWorksDescription: The subsidy is paid directly to your childcare center, which reduces your out-of-pocket fees. The amount you receive depends on your family income, the type of childcare, and how many hours of recognised activity (like work or study) you do.

incomeBrackets.title: How much could your family save?

bracket1.example: A $150/day fee could cost as little as $15/day

bracket4.example: You may pay the full daily fee

ccs.mostFamiliesSave: Most families pay 50-85% less than the listed fee
ccs.ccsApprovedExplainer: This means the government subsidy applies here — you pay the reduced rate, not the full fee.

q1.question: How do I apply for the Child Care Subsidy?
q1.answer: You apply through your myGov account linked to Centrelink. You'll need your tax file number and income details. The center can help you get started.

q2.question: Do I need to be an Australian citizen to get CCS?
q2.answer: You need to be an Australian resident. Permanent residents and some visa holders are eligible. Check with Centrelink or ask the center for guidance.

q3.question: When does the subsidy start?
q3.answer: CCS can start from the first day your child attends an approved center, as long as your claim has been processed. Apply early to avoid delays.

q4.question: Does CCS cover all types of childcare?
q4.answer: CCS covers approved Long Day Care, Family Day Care, and Outside School Hours Care. All centers on LittleBridge are CCS-approved unless otherwise noted.

q5.question: Can I get help applying for CCS in Chinese?
q5.answer: Yes! You can call the Centrelink multilingual phone service (131 202) and request Mandarin or Cantonese interpretation. Many centers with bilingual staff can also help guide you through the process.

family.title: Values Match Quiz
family.subtitle: Answer 5 quick questions to help us find centers that share your values (about 60 seconds)

question1.label: What's your preferred approach to learning?
question1.option2: Balanced mix of play and structured learning

question2.label: How important are cultural celebrations and events?
question2.option1: Very important — we'd love to see Chinese festivals celebrated
question2.option2: Somewhat important — nice to have but not essential
question2.option3: Not a priority — focus on Australian celebrations

question3.label: How often would you like updates about your child?

question4.label: How important is outdoor time?
question4.option1: Very important — the more outdoor play the better
question4.option2: A good balance of indoor and outdoor

question5.label: Meal preferences?
question5.option1: We'd love Asian meal options included
question5.option2: Flexible — as long as it's nutritious

family.complete: Quiz complete! Your answers will help us find your best matches.
family.improvePrompt: Want better matches? Take our 60-second values quiz

educator.title: Values Match Quiz
educator.subtitle: Help us match you with centers that share your approach to early childhood education

question1.label: What's your preferred teaching approach?
question1.option2: Balanced mix of play and structured activities

question2.label: How do you approach cultural programming?
question2.option1: Actively integrate multicultural celebrations and activities
question2.option2: Include cultural elements when opportunities arise

question3.label: How do you prefer to communicate with families?

question4.label: Your approach to outdoor play?
question4.option2: Good balance of indoor and outdoor activities

question5.label: Your view on bilingual programming?
question5.option1: Essential — should be integrated into daily routines
question5.option2: Valuable — dedicated bilingual sessions are great
question5.option3: Nice to have — English immersion is the priority

educator.complete: Quiz complete! This helps us match you with aligned centers.

center.title: Values Match Quiz

question1.label: Your center's learning approach?

founderStory.title: Built by a parent who understands
founderStory.paragraph1: Hi, I'm June. When I was looking for childcare for my own child, I spent weeks calling centers, struggling to find one with Mandarin-speaking staff who could make my child feel safe and understood.
founderStory.paragraph2: I realised every Chinese-Australian parent I knew had the same experience — scrolling through English-only websites, making anxious phone calls, never knowing which centers had bilingual staff until they visited in person.
founderStory.paragraph3: LittleBridge was born from that frustration. I built it so that no family has to go through what I went through — so that finding a center where your child feels at home is the beginning of the journey, not an impossible obstacle.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.statement: To make bilingual childcare accessible to every family that needs it — so that children can be understood, comforted, and educated in the languages they speak at home.

trust.title: Why You Can Trust Us
trust.signal2: Built and run by parents in Sydney and Melbourne
trust.signal3: Your data is protected by Australian privacy law — we never share your personal information
trust.signal4: Every center on LittleBridge is a real, licensed childcare provider
trust.signal5: Free to search and enquire — families never pay

privacy.title: Your Privacy
privacy.subtitle: We take your family's privacy seriously. Here's the simple version:
privacy.dataLocation: Your data is protected by Australian privacy law
privacy.dataLocationDetail: All information is stored securely in the Asia-Pacific region and governed by Australian privacy legislation.
privacy.noSharing: We never share your personal information
privacy.noSharingDetail: Your details are only shared with centers you choose to enquire with. We never sell or share your data with third parties.
privacy.deleteAnytime: You can delete your account at any time
privacy.deleteAnytimeDetail: Request account deletion from your settings page and all your data will be permanently removed within 30 days.
privacy.childrenDataDetail: We collect minimal information about children (name, age, and care needs only). This information is used solely to match your family with suitable centers and is never used for marketing purposes.
privacy.contactUs: Questions about your privacy? Contact us at privacy@littlebridge.com.au

titles.home: LittleBridge — Bilingual Childcare Marketplace | Sydney & Melbourne
titles.ccs: Understanding the Child Care Subsidy | LittleBridge

descriptions.home: LittleBridge connects Mandarin-speaking families with childcare centers and bilingual educators in Sydney and Melbourne. Search in Chinese or English.
descriptions.search: Search for childcare centers with Mandarin-speaking staff near you. Filter by language, location, and values match. Free to search.
descriptions.jobs: Find childcare jobs that truly value your bilingual skills. Mandarin, Cantonese, and English positions in Sydney and Melbourne.
descriptions.pricing: List your childcare center on LittleBridge for $99/month. Reach bilingual families and hire bilingual educators. 14-day free trial.
descriptions.about: LittleBridge was built by parents who understand the challenge of finding bilingual childcare in Australia.
descriptions.ccs: Understand the Child Care Subsidy in plain language. See how much your family could save on childcare fees.
